page.title: 20Wroxton Abbey grounds
page.content: Since 1978 the grounds have undergone restoration. This includes new tree and rose planting, tree surgery, clearance of scrub and dead wood from vistas, the Ha-ha, and the Mount, and the repair and opening of the dovecote and ice- house to the public. The lakes have been dredged and re-shaped and the grand cascade rebuilt. This has only been possible through many private donations and the grants from the Historic Buildings Council, Stanley Smith Horticural Trust, Robinson Trust and the Countryside Commission. The grounds are now open daily and a pass needs to be obtained from reception. The students use the grounds for outdoor activities such as volleyball. Local groups use them for presenting open air plays, area Guide activities etc. The grounds are full of wild life such as swans, deer and squirrels etc.
